turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about T Lavitz.
turn.1: What can you tell me about T Lavitz's Fortune 410?
turn.2: This CD also features his Dregs bandmate Rod Morgenstein, guitarist Jeff Pevar (who also produced the project), bassist David Livolsi and a number of special guests, including Alphonso Johnson, Bill Evans, Howard Levy, Luis Conte, Bill Holloman and Jerry Goodman.
turn.4: See http://pevar.com/music/jazzisdead-gratefuljazz/ for more info The Dixie Dregs did a short tour in late August 1999.
turn.5: What other interesting information can you tell me about the tour?
turn.6: The band was joined by original members Andy West and Allen Sloan.
turn.7: Did anything happen while on tour?
turn.8: Lavitz continued touring with Jazz Is Dead and also whenever possible with the Dixie Dregs.
turn.9: When did they get back together?
turn.10: In the first part of the new millennium T Lavitz took part in several projects. ' Endangered Species', with Jimmy Herring, Richie Hayward and Kenny Gradney was released in 2001, 'Cosmic Farm', with Rob Wasserman, Craig Erickson and Jeff Sipe, was released in 2005 and 'Boston T Party', with Dennis Chambers, Jeff Berlin and Dave Fiuczynski, was released in 2006.
turn.11: Did any of them happen to be successful?
turn.12: In the summer of 2006 he began teaching at the Summer Performance Program at the Berklee College of Music, Boston, MA. Lavitz died on October 7, 2010.
